page.title: 01CATERHAM
page.content: Caterham is situated on the{NORTH {DOWNS}between 300 & 800 feet above sea level. It consists of two separate communities, those living in the valley and those living on the hill. Caterham Hill was the original settlement. The Valley developed as a result of the{RAILWAY}being built in 1856. About half the area is{RESIDENTIAL, well provided with schools, shops, an open market, churches and open spaces. {LEISURE}is catered for by a leisure centre, community centre, theatre and parks. The area is well served by public transport.There are frequent{TRAINS}to Croydon and London.{BUSES}connect Caterham to local towns. Caterham is situated on the A22 and is near the M23 and M25.{LONDON GATWICK {AIRPORT}is 20 minutes away by road.
